sentences.en: "There we go," said Diane, a trifle too cheerily.
sentences.cn: “这就对了，”黛安娜说道，语气有点儿过于兴高采烈。

sentences.en: a trifle stingy.
sentences.cn: 有点儿小气

sentences.en: As a photographer, he'd found both locations just a trifle disappointing.
sentences.cn: 作为摄影师，他感到两处景点都有点儿不尽如人意。

sentences.en: Believe me, it's the least I can do, a mere trifle.
sentences.cn: 相信我，这是我最起码能做的了，只是小事一桩。

sentences.en: Don't kick up a row about such trifle.
sentences.cn: 不要为小事去胡闹.

sentences.en: Don't lose your temper over such a trifle.
sentences.cn: 不要为这点小事发脾气.

sentences.en: Don't trifle away your time.
sentences.cn: 不要虚度光阴.

sentences.en: He had no money to spare on trifles.
sentences.cn: 他没钱花在琐碎的东西上。

sentences.en: He’s not a man to be trifled with.
sentences.cn: 他这个人怠慢不得。

sentences.en: His uniform made him look a trifle out of place.
sentences.cn: 他的制服让他看起来有些格格不入。

sentences.en: I'll have just a trifle of the dessert.
sentences.cn: 我只要吃少量的甜点心.

sentences.en: It is a mere trifle.
sentences.cn: 那只是无关紧要的琐事而已.

sentences.en: It's senseless to get angry over such a trifle.
sentences.cn: 不值得为这点小事惹气.

sentences.en: men who trifle with women’s affections
sentences.cn: 玩弄女性感情的男人

sentences.en: She seemed a trifle anxious.
sentences.cn: 她似乎有点儿焦急。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister smiled again, this time a trifle frostily.
sentences.cn: 首相又笑了笑，这回有点儿冷冰冰的。

sentences.en: The wine has made him a trifle tipsy.
sentences.cn: 这酒喝得他有点醉意了.

sentences.en: There’s no point in arguing over trifles.
sentences.cn: 为琐事争吵毫无意义。

sentences.en: This bag is a trifle too heavy.
sentences.cn: 这袋稍重了一点.

sentences.en: This chair is a trifle rocky.
sentences.cn: 这把椅子有点摇晃.

phrases.tran_cn: 玩弄；视同儿戏；心不在焉地做

trans.tran_en: to treat someone or something without respect or not in a serious way
